definition: to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to bombard/to bomb/trad. also written 炮轟
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: There are shelled the Preah Vihear Temple in the military demands of the masses.
sentences.chinese: 还有群众要求军方炮轰柏威夏寺。

sentences.english: University student Kicked Out OfSchoolFor Censuring Foreign LanguageEducation?
sentences.chinese: 炮轰外语教育大学生被开除？

sentences.english: Waxman launched his first formal salvo last August.
sentences.chinese: 去年8月，华克斯曼第一次正式发动炮轰。

sentences.english: He dismissed suggestions that many civilians have also died in the army shelling.
sentences.chinese: 他还驳回了很多平民死于军队炮轰的说法。

sentences.english: They shelled and blockaded Visoko, where Canadians (peacekeepers) were posted.
sentences.chinese: 他们炮轰并封锁加拿大维和部队驻扎的维索科镇。

sentences.english: Hundreds of Americans bombarded Congress with angry letters and telegrams of protest.
sentences.chinese: 许多民众愤怒的信件和抗议的电报炮轰了议会。

sentences.english: My great-grandmother died of a heart attack while the Germans were shelling those men.
sentences.chinese: 德军炮轰他们时，我曾祖母因心脏病去世了。

sentences.english: It was dark when the cannonading stopped all of a sudden.
sentences.chinese: 到了天黑之后，炮轰才突然停止。

sentences.english: To press this point, once again the British attacked the Dagu forts.
sentences.chinese: 为达目的，英军再次炮轰大沽炮台。

sentences.english: The city was bombed intensively and many were wounded.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市被加强的炮轰，许多人都受了伤。

sentences.english: This was what Enjolras had caught in the intervals of the cannonade and the musketry.
sentences.chinese: 安灼拉在炮轰和排枪之间所听到的就是这些声音。

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to vilify sb wantonly/unrestrained attack (on sb)
